name: Admin
description: APIs for managing title configurations, uploaded Game Server code executables, and user data

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description: Time this news was published. If not set, defaults to now.

properties.name: Title
properties.description: Title (headline) of the news item

properties.name: Body
properties.description: Body text of the news

properties.name: NewsId
properties.description: Unique id of the new news item

properties.name: BuildId
properties.description: unique identifier for the build executable

properties.name: CommandLineTemplate
properties.description: appended to the end of the command line when starting game servers

properties.name: ExecutablePath
properties.description: path to the game server executable. Defaults to gameserver.exe

properties.name: ActiveRegions
properties.description: server host regions in which this build should be running and available

properties.name: Comment
properties.description: developer comment(s) for this build

properties.name: MaxGamesPerHost
properties.description: maximum number of game server instances that can run on a single host machine

properties.name: BuildId
properties.description: unique identifier for this build executable

properties.name: ActiveRegions
properties.description: array of regions where this build can used, when it is active

properties.name: MaxGamesPerHost
properties.description: maximum number of game server instances that can run on a single host machine

properties.name: CommandLineTemplate
properties.description: appended to the end of the command line when starting game servers

properties.name: ExecutablePath
properties.description: path to the game server executable. Defaults to gameserver.exe

properties.name: Comment
properties.description: developer comment(s) for this build

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description: time this build was last modified (or uploaded, if this build has never been modified)

properties.name: Status
properties.description: the current status of the build validation and processing steps

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose virtual currency balance is to be increased.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which is to be incremented.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: Amount to be added to the user balance of the specified virtual currency.

properties.name: VirtualCurrencies
properties.description: List of virtual currencies and their initial deposits (the amount a user is granted when signing in for the first time) to the title

CatalogItem.name: CatalogItem
CatalogItem.description: A purchasable item from the item catalog

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: unique identifier for this item

properties.name: ItemClass
properties.description: class to which the item belongs

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: catalog item for this item

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: text name for the item, to show in-game

properties.name: Description
properties.description: text description of item, to show in-game

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyPrices
properties.description: price of this item in virtual currencies and "RM" (the base Real Money purchase price, in USD pennies)

properties.name: RealCurrencyPrices
properties.description: override prices for this item for specific currencies

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: list of item tags

properties.name: CustomData
properties.description: game specific custom data

properties.name: GrantedIfPlayerHas
properties.description: array of ItemId values which are evaluated when any item is added to the player inventory - if all items in this array are present, the this item will also be added to the player inventory

properties.name: Consumable
properties.description: defines the consumable properties (number of uses, timeout) for the item

properties.name: Container
properties.description: defines the container properties for the item - what items it contains, including random drop tables and virtual currencies, and what item (if any) is required to open it via the UnlockContainerItem API

properties.name: Bundle
properties.description: defines the bundle properties for the item - bundles are items which contain other items, including random drop tables and virtual currencies

properties.name: CanBecomeCharacter
properties.description: if true, then this item instance can be used to grant a character to a user.

properties.name: IsStackable
properties.description: if true, then only one item instance of this type will exist and its remaininguses will be incremented instead

properties.name: BundledItems
properties.description: unique ItemId values for all items which will be added to the player inventory when the bundle is added

properties.name: BundledResultTables
properties.description: unique TableId values for all RandomResultTable objects which are part of the bundle (random tables will be resolved and add the relevant items to the player inventory when the bundle is added)

properties.name: BundledVirtualCurrencies
properties.description: virtual currency types and balances which will be added to the player inventory when the bundle is added

properties.name: UsageCount
properties.description: number of times this object can be used, after which it will be removed from the player inventory

properties.name: UsagePeriod
properties.description: duration in seconds for how long the item will remain in the player inventory - once elapsed, the item will be removed

properties.name: UsagePeriodGroup
properties.description: all inventory item instances in the player inventory sharing a non-null UsagePeriodGroup have their UsagePeriod values added together, and share the result - when that period has elapsed, all the items in the group will be removed

CatalogItemContainerInfo.name: CatalogItemContainerInfo
CatalogItemContainerInfo.description: Containers are inventory items that can hold other items defined in the catalog, as well as virtual currency, which is added to the player inventory when the container is unlocked, using the UnlockContainerItem API. The items can be anything defined in the catalog, as well as RandomResultTable objects which will be resolved when the container is unlocked. Containers and their keys should be defined as Consumable (having a limited number of uses) in their catalog defintiions, unless the intent is for the player to be able to re-use them infinitely.

properties.name: KeyItemId
properties.description: ItemId for the catalog item used to unlock the container, if any (if not specified, a call to UnlockContainerItem will open the container, adding the contents to the player inventory and currency balances)

properties.name: ItemContents
properties.description: unique ItemId values for all items which will be added to the player inventory, once the container has been unlocked

properties.name: ResultTableContents
properties.description: unique TableId values for all RandomResultTable objects which are part of the container (once unlocked, random tables will be resolved and add the relevant items to the player inventory)

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyContents
properties.description: virtual currency types and balances which will be added to the player inventory when the container is unlocked

properties.name: Filename
properties.description: Name of the javascript file. These names are not used internally by the server, they are only for developer organizational purposes.

properties.name: FileContents
properties.description: Contents of the Cloud Script javascript. Must be string-escaped javascript.

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Version number

properties.name: PublishedRevision
properties.description: Published code revision for this Cloud Script version

properties.name: LatestRevision
properties.description: Most recent revision for this Cloud Script version

properties.name: Key
properties.description: Key of the content

properties.name: Size
properties.description: Size of the content in bytes

properties.name: LastModified
properties.description: Last modified time

properties.name: Key
properties.description: Key of the content item to be deleted

properties.name: Gamemode
properties.description: specific game mode type

properties.name: MinPlayerCount
properties.description: minimum user count required for this Game Server Instance to continue (usually 1)

properties.name: MaxPlayerCount
properties.description: maximum user count a specific Game Server Instance can support

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Which catalog is being requested.

properties.name: Catalog
properties.description: Array of items which can be purchased.

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Version number. If left null, defaults to the latest version

properties.name: Revision
properties.description: Revision number. If left null, defaults to the latest revision

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Version number.

properties.name: Revision
properties.description: Revision number.

properties.name: CreatedAt
properties.description: Time this revision was created

properties.name: Files
properties.description: List of Cloud Script files in this revision.

properties.name: IsPublished
properties.description: True if this is the currently published revision

properties.name: Versions
properties.description: List of versions

properties.name: Prefix
properties.description: Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix. You can use prefixes to list contents under a folder, or for a specified version, etc.

properties.name: ItemCount
properties.description: Number of content items returned. We currently have a maximum of 1000 items limit.

properties.name: TotalSize
properties.description: The total size of listed contents in bytes

properties.name: Key
properties.description: Key of the content item to upload, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

properties.name: ContentType
properties.description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the contents. The same MIME type has to be set in the header when uploading the content.

properties.name: URL
properties.description: URL for uploading content via HTTP PUT method. The URL will expire in 1 hour.

properties.name: ReportName
properties.description: Report name

properties.name: Year
properties.description: Reporting year (UTC)

properties.name: Month
properties.description: Reporting month (UTC)

properties.name: Day
properties.description: Reporting year (UTC)

properties.name: LobbyId
properties.description: unique identifier of the lobby for which info is being requested

properties.name: LobbyId
properties.description: unique identifier of the lobby

properties.name: TitleId
properties.description: unique identifier of the Game Server Instance for this lobby

properties.name: StartTime
properties.description: time when the Game Server Instance was created

properties.name: EndTime
properties.description: time when Game Server Instance is currently scheduled to end

properties.name: Mode
properties.description: game mode for this Game Server Instance

properties.name: BuildVersion
properties.description: version identifier of the game server executable binary being run

properties.name: Region
properties.description: region in which the Game Server Instance is running

properties.name: Players
properties.description: array of unique PlayFab identifiers for users currently connected to this Game Server Instance

properties.name: ServerAddress
properties.description: IP address for this Game Server Instance

properties.name: ServerPort
properties.description: communication port for this Game Server Instance

properties.name: BuildVersion
properties.description: previously uploaded build version for which game modes are being requested

properties.name: GameModes
properties.description: array of game modes available for the specified build

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: array of keys to get back data from the Publisher data blob, set by the admin tools

properties.name: Data
properties.description: a dictionary object of key / value pairs

properties.name: Tables
properties.description: array of random result tables currently available

properties.name: BuildId
properties.description: unique identifier of the previously uploaded build executable for which information is being requested

properties.name: Data

properties.name: CatalogVersion

properties.name: VirtualCurrency

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyRechargeTimes

properties.name: CatalogVersion

properties.name: ItemGrants
properties.description: Array of items to grant and the users to whom the items are to be granted.

ItemInstance.name: ItemInstance

properties.name: ItemInstanceId

properties.name: ItemClass

properties.name: PurchaseDate

properties.name: Expiration

properties.name: RemainingUses

properties.name: CustomData

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: User currency was subtracted from.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which was modified.

properties.name: BalanceChange
properties.description: Amount added or subtracted from the user's virtual currency.

properties.name: Balance
properties.description: Balance of the virtual currency after modification.

properties.name: TableId
properties.description: Unique name for this drop table

properties.name: Nodes
properties.description: Child nodes that indicate what kind of drop table item this actually is.

properties.name: BuildId
properties.description: unique identifier of the previously uploaded build executable to be removed

properties.name: Users
properties.description: Array of users to reset

properties.name: ResultItemType
properties.description: Whether this entry in the table is an item or a link to another table

properties.name: ResultItem
properties.description: Either an ItemId, or the TableId of another random result table

properties.name: Weight
properties.description: How likely this is to be rolled - larger numbers add more weight

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: unique PlayFab identifier for the user account which is to have the specified item removed

properties.name: ItemInstanceId
properties.description: unique PlayFab identifier for the item instance to be removed

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Version number

properties.name: Revision
properties.description: Revision to make the current published revision

properties.name: Key
properties.description: key we want to set a value on (note, this is additive - will only replace an existing key's value if they are the same name.) Keys are trimmed of whitespace. Keys may not begin with the '!' character.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: new value to set. Set to null to remove a value

properties.name: Key
properties.description: key we want to set a value on (note, this is additive - will only replace an existing key's value if they are the same name.) Keys are trimmed of whitespace. Keys may not begin with the '!' character.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: new value to set. Set to null to remove a value

properties.name: Name
properties.description: name of the application sending the message (application names must be made up of only uppercase and lowercase ASCII letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens, and periods, and must be between 1 and 256 characters long)

properties.name: Platform
properties.description: supported notification platforms are Apple Push Notification Service (APNS and APNS_SANDBOX) for iOS and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) for Android

properties.name: Key
properties.description: for APNS, this is the PlatformPrincipal (SSL Certificate)

properties.name: Credential
properties.description: Credential is the Private Key for APNS/APNS_SANDBOX, and the API Key for GCM

properties.name: OverwriteOldARN
properties.description: replace any existing ARN with the newly generated one. If this is set to false, an error will be returned if notifications have already setup for this platform.

properties.name: ARN
properties.description: Amazon Resource Name for the created notification topic.

StoreItem.name: StoreItem
StoreItem.description: A store entry that list a catalog item at a particular price

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: unique identifier of the item as it exists in the catalog - note that this must exactly match the ItemId from the catalog

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyPrices
properties.description: price of this item in virtual currencies and "RM" (the base Real Money purchase price, in USD pennies)

properties.name: RealCurrencyPrices
properties.description: override prices for this item for specific currencies

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose virtual currency balance is to be decreased.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which is to be decremented.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: Amount to be subtracted from the user balance of the specified virtual currency.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: which catalog is being updated

properties.name: Catalog
properties.description: array of catalog items to be submitted

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Cloud Script version to update. If null, defaults to most recent version

properties.name: Files
properties.description: List of Cloud Script files to upload to create the new revision. Must have at least one file.

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Cloud Script version updated

properties.name: Revision
properties.description: New revision number created

properties.name: Tables
properties.description: array of random result tables to make available (Note: specifying an existing TableId will result in overwriting that table, while any others will be added to the available set)

properties.name: StoreId
properties.description: unqiue identifier for the store which is to be updated

properties.name: Store
properties.description: array of store items - references to catalog items, with specific pricing - to be added

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data to be written to the user's custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited to 1024 characters, and may not begin with a '!' character.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permission to be applied to all user data keys written in this request. Defaults to "private" if not set.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data to be written to the user's custom data.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose title specific display name is to be changed

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: new title display name for the user - must be between 3 and 25 characters

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: current title display name for the user (this will be the original display name if the rename attempt failed)

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: unique identifier for the user account

properties.name: Created
properties.description: timestamp indicating when the user account was created

properties.name: Username
properties.description: user account name in the PlayFab service

properties.name: TitleInfo
properties.description: title-specific information for the user account

properties.name: PrivateInfo
properties.description: personal information for the user which is considered more sensitive

properties.name: FacebookInfo
properties.description: user Facebook information, if a Facebook account has been linked

properties.name: SteamInfo
properties.description: user Steam information, if a Steam account has been linked

properties.name: GameCenterInfo
properties.description: user Gamecenter information, if a Gamecenter account has been linked

properties.name: Username
properties.description: Username of user to reset

properties.name: Value
properties.description: User-supplied data for this user data key.

properties.name: LastUpdated
properties.description: Timestamp indicating when this data was last updated.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permissions on this data key.

properties.name: FacebookId
properties.description: Facebook identifier

properties.name: FullName
properties.description: Facebook full name

properties.name: GameCenterId
properties.description: Gamecenter identifier

properties.name: Email
properties.description: user email address

properties.name: SteamId
properties.description: Steam identifier

properties.name: SteamCountry
properties.description: the country in which the player resides, from Steam data

properties.name: SteamCurrency
properties.description: currency type set in the user Steam account

properties.name: SteamActivationStatus
properties.description: what stage of game ownership the user is listed as being in, from Steam

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: name of the user, as it is displayed in-game

properties.name: Origination
properties.description: source by which the user first joined the game, if known

properties.name: Created
properties.description: timestamp indicating when the user was first associated with this game (this can differ significantly from when the user first registered with PlayFab)

properties.name: LastLogin
properties.description: timestamp for the last user login for this title

properties.name: FirstLogin
properties.description: timestamp indicating when the user first signed into this game (this can differ from the Created timestamp, as other events, such as issuing a beta key to the user, can associate the title to the user)

properties.name: isBanned
properties.description: boolean indicating whether or not the user is currently banned for a title

properties.name: CurrencyCode
properties.description: unique two-character identifier for this currency type (e.g.: "CC", "GC")

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: friendly name to show in the developer portal, reports, etc.

properties.name: InitialDeposit
properties.description: amount to automatically grant users upon first login to the tilte

properties.name: RechargeRate
properties.description: rate at which the currency automatically be added to over time, in units per day (24 hours)

properties.name: RechargeMax
properties.description: maximum amount to which the currency will recharge (cannot exceed MaxAmount, but can be less)

properties.name: SecondsToRecharge
properties.description: Time remaining (in seconds) before the next recharge increment of the virtual currency.

properties.name: RechargeTime
properties.description: Server timestamp in UTC indicating the next time the virtual currency will be incremented.

properties.name: RechargeMax
properties.description: Maximum value to which the regenerating currency will automatically increment. Note that it can exceed this value through use of the AddUserVirtualCurrency API call. However, it will not regenerate automatically until it has fallen below this value.

calls.name: GetUserAccountInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the relevant details for a specified user, based upon a match against a supplied unique identifier
calls.requestDetails: This API allows for access to details regarding a user in the PlayFab service, usually for purposes of customer support. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: ResetUsers
calls.summary: Resets all title-specific information about a particular account, including user data, virtual currency balances, inventory, purchase history, and statistics
calls.requestDetails: This method is intended for use with test accounts, to allow a developer to reset and test a game experience from the start. Note that in order to reset an account, you must know the username and password. If the account does not have a username and password, you must add one with AddUsernamePassword in the client API prior to calling this method.

calls.name: SendAccountRecoveryEmail
calls.summary: Forces an email to be sent to the registered email address for the specified account, with a link allowing the user to change the password
calls.requestDetails: If the account in question is a "temporary" account (for example, one that was created via a call to LoginFromIOSDeviceID), thisfunction will have no effect. Only PlayFab accounts which have valid email addresses will be able to receive a password reset email using this API.

calls.name: UpdateUserTitleDisplayName
calls.summary: Updates the title specific display name for a user
calls.requestDetails: In addition to the PlayFab username, titles can make use of a DisplayName which is also a unique identifier, but specific to the title. This allows for unique names which more closely match the theme or genre of a title, for example. This API enables changing that name, whether due to a customer request, an offensive name choice, etc.

calls.name: GetDataReport
calls.summary: Retrieves a download URL for the requested report
calls.requestDetails: An HTTP GET request to the returned report download URL returns the report data in line delimited JSON format. Each line contains a JSON object representing details of a single item in the report. Currently available reports: PurchaseDataReport, TitleNewUserReport, TitleActiveUsersReport, BannedUsersReport.

calls.name: GetUserData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: ResetUserStatistics
calls.summary: Completely removes all statistics for the specified user, for the current game
calls.requestDetails: Note that this action cannot be un-done. All statistics for this user will be deleted, removing the user from all leaderboards for the game.

calls.name: UpdateUserData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: AddNews
calls.summary: Adds a new news item to the title's news feed

calls.name: AddVirtualCurrencyTypes
calls.summary: Adds one or more virtual currencies to the set defined for the title
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Any new currencies defined in the array will be added to the set of those available for the title, while any CurrencyCode identifiers matching existing ones in the game will be overwritten with the new values.

calls.name: GetCatalogItems
calls.summary: Retrieves the specified version of the title's catalog of virtual goods, including all defined properties

calls.name: GetRandomResultTables
calls.summary: Retrieves the random drop table configuration for the title

calls.name: GetStoreItems
calls.summary: Retrieves the set of items defined for the specified store, including all prices defined
calls.requestDetails: A store contains an array of references to items defined in one or more catalog versions of the game, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

calls.name: GetTitleData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to return title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build.

calls.name: ListVirtualCurrencyTypes
calls.summary: Retuns the list of all defined virtual currencies for the title

calls.name: SetCatalogItems
calls.summary: Creates the catalog configuration of all virtual goods for the specified catalog version
calls.requestDetails: This operation is not additive. Using it will cause the indicated catalog version to be created from scratch. If there is an existing catalog with the version number in question, it will be deleted and replaced with only the items specified in this call.

calls.name: SetStoreItems
calls.summary: Sets all the items in one virtual store
calls.requestDetails: This operation is not additive. Using it will cause the indicated virtual store to be created from scratch. If there is an existing store with the same storeId, it will be deleted and replaced with only the items specified in this call. A store contains an array of references to items defined in one or more catalog versions of the game, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

calls.name: SetTitleData
calls.summary: Creates and updates the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: SetupPushNotification
calls.summary: Sets the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for iOS and Android push notifications. Documentation on the exact restrictions can be found at: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/api/API_CreatePlatformApplication.html. Currently, Amazon device Messaging is not supported.
calls.requestDetails: When using the Apple Push Notification service (APNS) or the development version (APNS_SANDBOX), the APNS Private Key should be used as the Credential in this call. With Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), the Android API Key should be used. The current ARN (if one exists) can be overwritten by setting the OverwriteOldARN boolean to true.

calls.name: UpdateCatalogItems
calls.summary: Updates the catalog configuration for virtual goods in the specified catalog version
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Items with ItemId values not currently in the catalog will be added, while those with ItemId values matching items currently in the catalog will overwrite those items with the given values.

calls.name: UpdateRandomResultTables
calls.summary: Updates the random drop table configuration for the title
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Tables with TableId values not currently defined will be added, while those with TableId values matching Tables currently in the catalog will be overwritten with the given values.

calls.name: UpdateStoreItems
calls.summary: Updates an existing virtual item store with new or modified items
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Items with ItemId values not currently in the store will be added, while those with ItemId values matching items currently in the catalog will overwrite those items with the given values. A store contains an array of references to items defined in one or more catalog versions of the game, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

calls.name: AddUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Increments the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: GetUserInventory
calls.summary: Retrieves the specified user's current inventory of virtual goods
calls.requestDetails: All items currently in the user inventory will be returned, irrespective of how they were acquired (via purchasing, grants, coupons, etc.). Items that are expired, fully consumed, or are no longer valid are not considered to be in the user's current inventory, and so will not be not included.

calls.name: GrantItemsToUsers
calls.summary: Adds the specified items to the specified user inventories
calls.requestDetails: This function directly adds inventory items to user inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition.

calls.name: RevokeInventoryItem
calls.summary: Revokes access to an item in a user's inventory
calls.requestDetails: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

calls.name: SubtractUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Decrements the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: GetMatchmakerGameInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the details for a specific completed session, including links to standard out and standard error logs

calls.name: GetMatchmakerGameModes
calls.summary: Retrieves the details of defined game modes for the specified game server executable
calls.requestDetails: These details are used by the PlayFab matchmaking service to determine if an existing Game Server Instance has room for additional users, and by the PlayFab game server management service to determine when a new Game Server Host should be created in order to prevent excess load on existing Hosts.

calls.name: ModifyMatchmakerGameModes
calls.summary: Updates the game server mode details for the specified game server executable
calls.requestDetails: These details are used by the PlayFab matchmaking service to determine if an existing Game Server Instance has room for additional users, and by the PlayFab game server management service to determine when a new Game Server Host should be created in order to prevent excess load on existing Hosts. This operation is not additive. Using it will cause the game mode definition for the game server executable in question to be created from scratch. If there is an existing game server mode definition for the given BuildVersion, it will be deleted and replaced with the data specified in this call.

calls.name: AddServerBuild
calls.summary: Adds the game server executable specified (previously uploaded - see GetServerBuildUploadUrl) to the set of those a client is permitted to request in a call to StartGame

calls.name: GetServerBuildInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the build details for the specified game server executable

calls.name: GetServerBuildUploadUrl
calls.summary: Retrieves the pre-authorized URL for uploading a game server package containing a build (does not enable the build for use - see AddServerBuild)

calls.name: ListServerBuilds
calls.summary: Retrieves the build details for all game server executables which are currently defined for the title

calls.name: ModifyServerBuild
calls.summary: Updates the build details for the specified game server executable

calls.name: RemoveServerBuild
calls.summary: Removes the game server executable specified from the set of those a client is permitted to request in a call to StartGame

calls.name: GetPublisherData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to return publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. For more information email devrel@playfab.com

calls.name: SetPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. This operation is additive.  If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value. For more information email devrel@playfab.com

calls.name: GetCloudScriptRevision
calls.summary: Gets the contents and information of a specific Cloud Script revision.

calls.name: GetCloudScriptVersions
calls.summary: Lists all the current cloud script versions. For each version, information about the current published and latest revisions is also listed.

calls.name: SetPublishedRevision
calls.summary: Sets the currently published revision of a title Cloud Script

calls.name: UpdateCloudScript
calls.summary: Creates a new Cloud Script revision and uploads source code to it. Note that at this time, only one file should be submitted in the revision.

calls.name: DeleteContent
calls.summary: Delete a content file from the title

calls.name: GetContentList
calls.summary: List all contents of the title and get statistics such as size

calls.name: GetContentUploadUrl
calls.summary: Retrieves the pre-signed URL for uploading a content file. A subsequent HTTP PUT to the returned URL uploads the content.
